info.title: Wallaroo MLOps API
info.description: Manage your Wallaroo Machine Learning Operations Platform.

tags.name: metrics
tags.description:
Query operations for retrieving metrics data.
All paths under `/v1/api/metrics` are compliant with the [Prometheus Querying HTTP API](https://prometheus.io/docs/prometheus/3.5/querying/api/). See the Prometheus documentation for more details.
Below are selected paths for querying metrics.

post.summary: Stream a large model directly into storage
post.description: Streams a potentially large model directly into storage.

schema.description: Name of the model in the workspace.

400.description: A required field was missing from the request

post.summary: Deployment statuses are made up of the engine pods and the statuses of the pipelines and models in each of the running engines

reason.description: Reason for the current pod status, if available.

details.description: Details from kubernetes about the pod state.

required_cpu.description: Minimum CPU required by the engine, if known.

required_memory.description: Memory required by the engine, if known.

pipeline_statuses.description: Statuses of pipelines serviced by the engine.

model_statuses.description: Statuses of models executed by the engine.

200.description: Returns the next run and last run timestamps for this assay.

end.description: Returns only [AssayResultV2]s with `window_end` times before this datetime.

start.description: Returns only [AssayResultV2]s with `window_end` times equal to or after this datetime.

200.description: Returns a list of assay results.

post.summary: Previewing takes the same arguments as [`crate::assays::http::schedule`] but introduces a new arg: PreviewWindow

200.description: Given two univariate data ranges, compute the statistical distance between them.

post.summary: Previewing a Baseline is requesting a histogram that shows how
post.description:
the baseline's data would be binned for comparison to windows.
The minimal response is therefore a dataframe:
_|    bins    | count
0| (-Inf, 0.1]| 5
1| (0.1, 0.24]| 10
2| (0.24, 0.4]| 11
3| (0.4, 0.45]| 6
4| (0.45, Inf)| 2

Bins may also have descriptive labels, such as quantiles, or user-provided labels.
The first and last bins, to infinity, are designated as outliers.

curl -X POST localhost:3040/v2/api/assays/preview_baseline_binning -H 'Authorization: Bearer test' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"baseline": {"Static": ["2023-07-16T15:40:28+00:00", "2023-07-26T15:40:28+00:00"]}}'
curl -X POST localhost:3040/v2/api/assays/preview_baseline_binning -H 'Authorization: Bearer test' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"baseline": {"Summary": {"bins": {"mode": {"Equal": 10}, "edges": [],"labels": []},"aggregated_values": [],"aggregation": "Edges","statistics": {"count": 21,"min": 1,"max": 21,"mean": 10,"median": 10,"std": 2}}}}'
curl -X POST http://localhost:3040/v2/api/assays/preview_baseline_binning -H 'Authorization: Bearer test' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"baseline": {"Static": ["2022-01-06T00:00:00+00:00", "2022-01-07T00:00:00+00:00"]}}' | jq .
curl -X POST http://localhost:3040/v2/api/assays/preview_baseline_binning -H 'Authorization: Bearer test' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"baseline": {"Static": ["2022-01-06T00:00:00+00:00", "2022-01-07T00:00:00+00:00"]}, "targeting": {"data_origin": {"pipeline_name": "modelinsightse2e05246", "workspace_id": 1}, "iopath": [{"field": "out.dense_2", "index": 9}]}, "summarizer": {"UnivariateContinuous": {"bin_mode": {"Equal": 8},"aggregation": "Density","metric": "PSI","bin_weights": null}}}'

200.description: Running a baseline interactively is a convenience shortcut for previewing the binning that an Assay's settings will use.

name.description: A descriptive name for an Assay.

post.description:
1. Taking 2 ranges of data
2. Summarizing them
3. Using a [`Metric`] to summarize the difference between their Summaries.

curl -X POST http://localhost:3040/v2/api/assays/score -H 'Authorization: Bearer test' -H 'Content-Type: application/json' -d '{"window": {"Stored": ["2022-01-06T00:00:00+00:00", "2022-01-07T00:00:00+00:00"]}, "baseline": {"Static": ["2022-01-01T00:00:00+00:00", "2022-01-02T00:00:00+00:00"]}, "summarizer": {"UnivariateContinuous": {"bin_mode":{"Equal":8},"aggregation":"Density","metric":"PSI","bin_weights":null}}}'

200.description: Given two univariate data ranges, compute the statistical distance between them.

active.description: Whether to turn this assay on or off

KvCacheDtype.description:
KV cache data type options for vLLM models.
See `--kv-cache-dtype` in [the vllm docs](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/v0.6.6/usage/engine_args.html) for details on supported options.

ListRegistriesResponse.description: Response object for the List Registries call.

registry_id.description: The unique identifier of the Model Registry in the Wallaroo system.

version.description: The version of the model in the remote Model Registry

ListRegistryModelVersionsRequest.description: Payload for the List Registry Models call.

ListRegistryModelsRequest.description: Payload for the List Registry Models call.

ModelConfig.description: Wrapper struct to add a realized database ID to an underlying data struct.

ModelConfigInner.description: Model configuration (mirrors row in model_config table in database)

ModelRegistry.description: A reference to a remote Model Registry, such as Azure Databricks MLFlow Registry

id.description: A unique identifier for this registry

name.description: A descriptive name for this registry

token.description:
A user token with access to the Registry.
Tokens must be in base64 format.

url.description:
The URL for accessing this registry
URLs should allow MLFlow Registry API access

deployed.description: True if any Deployments have an associated DeploymentModelConfig that associates with this model.

aic_enable_depth_first.description: Enables DFS with default memory size.

ctx_len.description: Maximum context that the compiled model can remember.

full_batch_size.description: Maximum number of sequences per iteration. Set to enable continuous batching mode.

num_cores.description: Number of cores used to compile the model.

num_devices.description: Number of SoCs in a given card to compile the model for. Each card (e.g. AI100) has 4 SoCs.

prefill_seq_len.description: The length of the Prefill prompt.

Quantization.description:
Quantization options for vLLM models.
See `--quantization` in [the vllm docs](https://docs.vllm.ai/en/v0.6.6/usage/engine_args.html) for details on supported options.

RegisteredModel.description:
A [RegisteredModel] is an MLFlow concept for a model that has been logged in MLFlow.
For more information, see <https://mlflow.org/docs/latest/model-registry.html#concepts>

RegisteredModelVersion.description: An MLFlow version of a [RegisteredModel]. Versions start at 1.

RemoveRegistryFromWorkspaceRequest.description: The required information for removing a Model Registry from a workspace

id.description: The unique identifier for the Model Registry

workspace_id.description: The unique identifier for the workspace.

SearchRegisteredModelVersionsResponse.description: The structure of the response from a 2.0 MLFlow API.

SearchRegisteredModelsResponse.description: The structure of the response from a 2.0 MLFlow API.

UploadFromRegistryRequest.description: Payload for the List Registries call.

name.description: A descriptive, DNS-safe name for this model in the Wallaroo system.

path.description: The path to the model file in the remote Model Registry.

registry_id.description: The unique identifier of the Model Registry in the Wallaroo system.

UploadFromRegistryResponse.description: Response object for the List Registry Models call.

registry_id.description:
The unique identifier for a Registry
Not compatible with file uploads, only used with `registry_uri` uploads

block_size.description: The block size to use for the model. Defaults to `None` but recommended to set to `32` for better performance with `Acceleration::Qaic`.

device_group.description: The list of device IDs to load the model on. Only required for `Acceleration::Qaic`.

model_ids.description:
Optional model identifiers.
If model_ids are passed in, we will create model_configs for them.

models.description:
Optional model.
Because model_ids may not be readily available for existing pipelines, they can pass in all the data again.

name.description: User-given name

should_run_publish.description: The pipeline publish ID this edge is supposed to run

ListEdgesResponse.description: Response with a list of edges.

ListPipelineItem.description: Response with a list of published pipelines.

ListPipelinesResponse.description: Response with a list of published pipelines.

pipeline_id.description: The unique identifier for a Pipeline

ListResponse.description: Response with a list of published pipelines.

edges.description: list of edges for the pipeline

Pipeline.description: Definition of an inference pipeline that can be deployed on the edge.

created_at.description:
When this [Pipeline] was created.
Optional because they are read-only

updated_at.description:
When this [Pipeline] was last updated.
Optional because they are read-only

error.description:
If [PipelinePublish::status] is in the [PipelinePublishStatus::Error] state,
this should be populated with the error that occurred.

StatusRequest.description: Request to fetch a pipeline publish status.

id.description: The ID of the pipeline publish

include_replace_bundles.description: Whether to include the bundles for the edges this pipeline publish is a replacement for

maximum_replicas.description: The maximum number of replicas a deployment can scale too

prewarmed_replicas.description: The number of instances to run, defaults to 0

ListTaskRunsRequestStatus.description:
The available filters for task run status
Please see [TaskStatus] for more details.

run_id.description: The ID of the Pod for this individual run. This is identical to `pod_id` in the database.

task.description: Task ID associated with this rnu.

updated_at.description: Time this run's status was last updated.

Orchestration.description: A struct that mirrors the data in Hasura's Orchestration table.

created_at.description:
When this [Orchestration] was first inserted into the db.
Optional because they are read-only

created_by.description: The user who created the orchestration

file_name.description: The name of the ZIP archive uploaded by the user. This may be user-provided.

file_size.description: The file size of the orchestration file

image_path.description:
Image path for orchestration deployment
This pins the orchestration to a specific image, mostly for version control

name.description: An optional descriptive name provided by the user.

owner_id.description: This is the UserID of the end user that initiated the upload of this [Orchestration]

sha.description: The sha256 [String] of the user's uploaded ZIP file.

updated_at.description:
When this [Orchestration] was last updated in the db.
Optional because they are read-only

workspace_id.description: The numeric identifier of the Workspace.

OrchestrationStatus.description: The possible states an [Orchestration]'s Packaging status can be in.

pause.description: Set true to pause, false to resume.

last_runs.description:
A list of the (by default: 5) most recent runs associated with this Task.
This will only ever be more than 1 in the case of the Scheduled/Cron run.

run_id.description: The ID of the Pod for this individual run. This is identical to `pod_id` in the database.

updated_at.description: Time this run's status was last updated.

TaskStatus.description: Possible states that a task can be in

AggregatedValues.description: The output of aggregating data across bins.

alert_threshold.description: The alert threshold for this assay result.

analyzed_at.description: The time the assay was analyzed.

created_at.description: The time the assay result was created.

elapsed_millis.description: The time the assay took to analyze.

id.description: Auto-incrementing integer for assays v1 compatibility.

pipeline_id.description: The pipeline ID this assay result is for.

updated_at.description: The time the assay result was updated.

warning_threshold.description: The warning threshold for this assay result.

workspace_id.description: The workspace ID this assay result is for.

workspace_name.description: The workspace name this assay result is for.

id.description: The ID of the created AssayConfigV2

name.description: A descriptive name displayed to the user for this Assay

AssayV2.description: This represents an entry in the `assays_v2` table in the database.

items.description:
Use a static timeframe as a Baseline.
This gets stored as a computed summary under the hood,
so it's only used during Baseline Preview or Assay Creation.

Static.description:
Use a static timeframe as a Baseline.
This gets stored as a computed summary under the hood,
so it's only used during Baseline Preview or Assay Creation.

Vector.description: Use a vector of values as a Baseline. This also supports null values that are converted to `f64::NAN`.

BinEdges.description:
A Vec of the right-edges of a set of histogram bins.
The right-edge may be [`std::f64::INFINITY`]

oneOf.description: For only using mean, std, etc.

BinModeEqual.description:
Implementation for [BinMode::Equal].

Currently, Equal bins calculations implicitly assume that the first and last bins will capture all outliers.
We could split this behavior out as we do in [BinMode::Quantile] and [BinMode::QuantileWithExplicitOutliers],
or make a configuration option that selectively includes or excludes outliers from the first/last bins.

BinModeQuantile.description:
Implementation for [BinMode::Quantile].

This differs from [BinMode::QuantileWithExplicitOutliers] in that there are exactly N number of bins, where N is the number of bins requested.
The first and last bins are [-INF, 1st Percentile) and [Last Percentile, INF)

BinModeQuantileWithExplicitOutlier.description:
Implementation for [BinMode::QuantileWithExplicitOutliers].

This differs from [BinMode::Quantile] in that there are 2 more bins added after the data has been broken into quantiles.
A [-INF, 0%) bin and a [100%, INF) bin.

Bins.description:
Bins are ranges for a dataset, ranging from [`std::f64::NEG_INFINITY`] to [`std::f64::INFINITY`].
A single bin is described by two values, the left edge (>=) and the right edge

DataBatch.description:
For Univariate assays, even though individual datums are not affecting each other's scores,
we can still process Univariate assays on all specified fields.

DataOrigin.description:
Specifies where the data this assay is [Targeting] is coming from.
Currently, this only refers to which "topic" in Plateau.

locations.description:
Edge Locations that this assay will include.
Functionally, this controls which Plateau partitions we include when collecting data for windows.

model_id.description:
If specified, only runs assays on inferences associated with this Model ID.
This currently is used to support assays on A/B testing pipelines
and will be replaced by

DataPath.description: Flexible way of designating what the assay is monitoring

field.description:
A name that can be used by [`polars::prelude::Field`] to extract a column of data from the inference records.
If the Named Field is not a [`polars::prelude::DataType::List`], the index is ignored.

indexes.description:
The indexes of the field to monitor, if a list.
If this is a scalar value instead, either pass an empty array or no array at all.
Structs are not currently supported.

FieldTaggedSummaries.description: This allows us to compute multiple [SeriesSummary]ies and score them in bulk.

end.description: Returns only [AssayResultV2]s with `window_end` times before this datetime.

start.description: Returns only [AssayResultV2]s with `window_end` times equal to or after this datetime.

Metric.description: How we calculate the score between two histograms/vecs.

MinimalSummary.description: A MinimalSummary is a stripped down version of the [`SeriesSummary`] that omits data that could be looked up from the [`crate::assays::univariate::baseline::Baseline`]

end.description: The end of the Baseline window used to calculate these statistics.

start.description: The start of the Baseline window used to calculate these statistics.

PGInterval.description:
A struct that allows you to specify "Run every 3 days", where days is the `interval` [IntervalUnit] and 3 is the `skip`.
This is used by Postgres (via init_assay_result.rs) to compute the next Start Time.

quantity.description: The Quantity portion of Postgres's INTERVAL type

RollingWindow.description:
[RollingWindow] can only be specified for background jobs and not individual /score calls.
Describes the timeframe on InferenceResults to aggregate and compare against the Baseline.

Cron.description: A cron string determining the run frequency of the assay.

name.description: A descriptive name for an Assay.

Scheduling.description:
Controls how an assay is scheduled.
We should be able to specify the start, end, and frequency.

end.description:
End time of the assay. After this time, no more runs will be made.
A None value indicates that this assay will run indefinitely.

first_run.description:
The first time that the assay will **run**.
This means that the first AssayResult will be calculated for
inferences after `first_run - window.width` date and before and including `first_run`

All assays are required to start at a specific time, default to now.

bin_index.description: The index of the bin where the maximum score difference occurs when MaxDiff metric is used.

score.description: The score for a given window and baseline summary.

scores.description: The score differences for each bin.

SeriesSummary.description: A statistical summary based off the given [`Aggregation`].

end.description: The end of the Baseline window used to calculate these statistics.

name.description: Name of the [`polars::prelude::Series`] this summary was made for.

start.description: The start of the Baseline window used to calculate these statistics.

SeriesSummaryStatistics.description: Statistics that may be useful for advanced users but are not directly used in calculating assays.

active.description: Whether to turn this assay on or off

Raw.description: Pass in the Window data directly.

items.description: Use data from the time range specified as the Window.

Stored.description: Use data from the time range specified as the Window.

StaticWindow.description:
This is only used for calls to the /score endpoint and not for background jobs.
Describes the timeframe on InferenceResults to aggregate and compare against the Baseline.

Targeting.description:
Simple univariate assays only observe changes in one value in an InferenceResult.
[`Targeting`] is our way of selecting what this value is.

Thresholds.description:
Thresholds are user-configured values that can be used to indicate that the system should
take additional action when scores deviate. The minimum action is to indicate these deviations
on graphs with different colors.

UnivariateContinuous.description: Defines the summarizer/test we want to conduct

bin_weights.description: Weights to bias the scoring function. Can be used to focus on tails or specific bins.

time.description: Evaluation timestamp (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

start.description: Start timestamp, inclusive (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

end.description: End timestamp, inclusive (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

step.description: Query resolution step width in duration format or float number of seconds

errorType.description: Error type (only present when status is 'error')

error.description: Error message (only present when status is 'error')

errorType.description: Error type (only present when status is 'error')

error.description: Error message (only present when status is 'error')

result.description: Query result data, format varies by resultType

resultType.description: Type of the query result (always 'matrix' for range queries)

BadRequestResponse.description: Bad Request - parameters are missing or incorrect

UnprocessableEntityResponse.description: Unprocessable Entity - expression can't be executed

ServiceUnavailableResponse.description: Service Unavailable - queries time out or abort

TimeParam.name: time
TimeParam.description: Evaluation timestamp (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

StartParam.name: start
StartParam.description: Start timestamp, inclusive (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

EndParam.name: end
EndParam.description: End timestamp, inclusive (RFC3339 format or Unix timestamp)

StepParam.name: step
StepParam.description: Query resolution step width in duration format or float number of seconds
